title: Add comments while viewing a PDF

toc.text: Annotations and drawing markup tools overview
Show annotations and drawing markup tools
Select an annotation or drawing markup tool
Change font size of annotation comments
Copy partial text in a comment
Add reactions to comments on shared files
Add comments in a text box or callout
Add a comment in text box
Set or change properties for the text box
Add comments in a file attachment

outline.text: Add comments while viewing a PDF
document
paragraphs: You can now use quick actions in a floating toolbar to add comments while viewing a PDF.
sentences: You can now use quick actions in a floating toolbar to add comments while viewing a PDF.

outline.text: The following quick actions are available for commenting based on your selection in a PDF:
paragraphs: Actions on text selection : When you select text, you can perform actions like Highlight text,
Underline text, Strikethrough text, Redact text, Copy text, and Edit a PDF.
Actions on image selection:  When you select an image you can perform actions like
Add sticky note, Highlight image, Redact image, Copy Image, and Edit a PDF.
Actions on highlighted selection:  When you select an existing highlighted comment
in a PDF you see quick actions to Add Note, Change Color, or Delete the comment.
sentences: Actions on text selection : When you select text, you can perform actions like Highlight text, Underline text, Strikethrough text, Redact text, Copy text, and Edit a PDF.
Actions on image selection:  When you select an image you can perform actions like Add sticky note, Highlight image, Redact image, Copy Image, and Edit a PDF.
Actions on highlighted selection:  When you select an existing highlighted comment in a PDF you see quick actions to Add Note, Change Color, or Delete the comment.

outline.text: Annotations and drawing markup tools
overview
paragraphs: Note: In Acrobat Reader, complete commenting tools are available only in PDFs
with commenting enabled.
You can use annotation and drawing markup tools to add comments. Comments are notes
and drawings that communicate ideas or provide feedback for PDFs. You can type a text
message using the Add text comment tool. Alternatively, you can use a drawing tool to add a
line, circle, or other shape and then type a message in the associated pop-up note. Text-
editing tools let you add editing marks to indicate changes that you want in the source
document.
sentences: Note: In Acrobat Reader, complete commenting tools are available only in PDFs with commenting enabled.
You can use annotation and drawing markup tools to add comments.
Comments are notes and drawings that communicate ideas or provide feedback for PDFs.
You can type a text message using the Add text comment tool.
Alternatively, you can use a drawing tool to add a line, circle, or other shape and then type a message in the associated pop-up note.
Text- editing tools let you add editing marks to indicate changes that you want in the source document.

outline.text: Note:
paragraphs: In Acrobat Pro, you can add tags to your comments so that readers with motion or vision
limitations can read them using assistive technologies.
sentences: In Acrobat Pro, you can add tags to your comments so that readers with motion or vision limitations can read them using assistive technologies.

outline.text: Show annotations and drawing markup tools
paragraphs: Annotations and markup tools don't appear by default, except when you open a PDF in a
sentences: Annotations and markup tools don't appear by default, except when you open a PDF in a

outline.text: managed review workflow.
paragraphs: 1.   Choose the  Comments  icon on the right pane to see the added comments.
sentences: 1.   Choose the  Comments  icon on the right pane to see the added comments.

outline.text: Comment pane
2.   The drawing markup tools are grouped under the  Draw freehand  tool in the floating
paragraphs: quick tools menu on the left.
sentences: quick tools menu on the left.

outline.text: Drawing Tools menu
Select an annotation or drawing markup tool
paragraphs: From the quick tools menu on the left, select the desired annotation to add to the PDF.
sentences: From the quick tools menu on the left, select the desired annotation to add to the PDF.

outline.text: Note:  After you make an initial comment, the tool changes back to the Select tool so that
you can move, resize, or edit your comment. (The  Pencil  and  Highlight   Text  tools stay
paragraphs: selected.)
sentences: selected.)

outline.text: Keep an annotation tool selected
You can add multiple comments without reselecting the tool.
paragraphs: 1.   In the Comment tools, select the tool you want to use (but don't use it yet).
2.   Select the  Use the same tool until it's unselected  icon
sentences: 1.   In the Comment tools, select the tool you want to use (but don't use it yet).
2.   Select the  Use the same tool until it's unselected  icon

outline.text: Add a comment
paragraphs: Note:   In Acrobat Reader , complete commenting tools are available only in PDFs that
have commenting enabled. PDFs in a review workflow typically include commenting
rights.
The most common type of comment is the Add a comment that resembles a sticky note.
The comment appears as a note icon on the page and a pop-up note for your text
message. You can Add a comment anywhere on the page or in the document area.
sentences: Note:   In Acrobat Reader , complete commenting tools are available only in PDFs that have commenting enabled.
PDFs in a review workflow typically include commenting rights.
The most common type of comment is the Add a comment that resembles a sticky note.
The comment appears as a note icon on the page and a pop-up note for your text message.
You can Add a comment anywhere on the page or in the document area.

outline.text: Use the Add a comment tool to add a text message in a pop-up note.
Steps to add a comment
paragraphs: 1.   Select the  Add a comment  tool
from the quick tools menu, and select where you
want to place the note.
2.   Type text in the pop-up note. You can also use the Select tool
to copy and paste
text from a PDF into the note.
sentences: 1.   Select the  Add a comment  tool from the quick tools menu, and select where you want to place the note.
2.   Type text in the pop-up note.
You can also use the Select tool to copy and paste text from a PDF into the note.

outline.text: Note:  If you close the pop-up note, your text remains.
Edit a comment
paragraphs: 1.   Select or double-click the note icon.
2.   (Optional) To change the comment properties, right-click the sticky note   icon or from
the options menu of the comment, select Properties. Modify the Sticky Note Properties
as desired and select  OK .
sentences: 1.   Select or double-click the note icon.
2.   (Optional) To change the comment properties, right-click the sticky note   icon or from the options menu of the comment, select Properties.
Modify the Sticky Note Properties as desired and select  OK .

outline.text: Change font size of annotation comments
paragraphs: 1.   Open the Preferences dialog box by pressing  Ctrl + K  (Windows) or  command +
K  (macOS).
2.   Under  Categories , select  Commenting .
3.   Select the  Font Size  drop-down menu and select the desired font size.
4.   Select  OK .
sentences: 1.   Open the Preferences dialog box by pressing  Ctrl + K  (Windows) or  command + K  (macOS).
2.   Under  Categories , select  Commenting .
3.   Select the  Font Size  drop-down menu and select the desired font size.
4.   Select  OK .

outline.text: Note:  Use the Commenting panel in the Preferences dialog box to change default pop-up
paragraphs: behavior, and other settings for creating and viewing comments
sentences: behavior, and other settings for creating and viewing comments

outline.text: Copy partial text in a comment
paragraphs: 1.   Click or double-click the note icon.
2.   Select the text, and then right-click and copy text.
sentences: 1.   Click or double-click the note icon.
2.   Select the text, and then right-click and copy text.

outline.text: Delete a comment
paragraphs: 1.   Open the PDF document in Adobe Acrobat. Locate and select the comment icon you
want to delete.
2.   Select Delete     from the contextual menu.
sentences: 1.   Open the PDF document in Adobe Acrobat.
Locate and select the comment icon you want to delete.
2.   Select Delete     from the contextual menu.

outline.text: Add a text comment
Use the  Add text comment  tool to type text anywhere on the PDF page.
paragraphs: 1.   From the Quick action toolbar menu, select  Add a comment  >  Add text Comment .
2.   Select the location on the page where you want to add the comment.
3.   (Optional) To change the text formatting, double-click the added text comment, select
the text, and then select the font, text alignment, and other text formatting you want.
sentences: 1.   From the Quick action toolbar menu, select  Add a comment  >  Add text Comment .
2.   Select the location on the page where you want to add the comment.
3.   (Optional) To change the text formatting, double-click the added text comment, select the text, and then select the font, text alignment, and other text formatting you want.

outline.text: Add reactions to comments on shared files
paragraphs: You can now enhance your reviews on shared PDFs in Acrobat by adding reaction emojis to
sentences: You can now enhance your reviews on shared PDFs in Acrobat by adding reaction emojis to

outline.text: comments, making the reviews more interactive. To add reactions:
paragraphs: 1.   Open a shared PDF and select the  Comments  panel.
2.   Select the emoticon icon next to the comment you want to react to. A dialog box
appears.
3.   Select an emoticon from the dialog box or use the search bar to find and select your
desired reaction.
sentences: 1.   Open a shared PDF and select the  Comments  panel.
2.   Select the emoticon icon next to the comment you want to react to.
A dialog box appears.
3.   Select an emoticon from the dialog box or use the search bar to find and select your desired reaction.

outline.text: Add an arrow, or shape
Note:   In Acrobat Reader  , drawing tools are available only in PDFs that have commenting
paragraphs: enabled. PDFs in a review workflow typically include commenting rights.
sentences: enabled.
PDFs in a review workflow typically include commenting rights.

outline.text: When selecting a drawing tool, consider the effect you want.
paragraphs: 1.   From the Quick action toolbar, select the  Draw freehand  tool and then select the
desired drawing markup tool:
The  Line  tool
,  the  Arrow  tool
, the  Rectangle  tool
and the  Circle  tool
lets you create simple shapes.
The  Cloud  tool
and  Polygon  tool
create closed shapes with multiple
segments. The  Connected lines  tool
creates open shapes with multiple
segments.
The  Draw  tool creates free-form drawings, and the  Erase a
drawing  tool
removes the drawing markups.
sentences: 1.   From the Quick action toolbar, select the  Draw freehand  tool and then select the desired drawing markup tool:
The  Line  tool ,  the  Arrow  tool , the  Rectangle  tool and the  Circle  tool lets you create simple shapes.
The  Cloud  tool and  Polygon  tool create closed shapes with multiple segments.
The  Connected lines  tool creates open shapes with multiple segments.
The  Draw  tool creates free-form drawings, and the  Erase a drawing  tool removes the drawing markups.

outline.text: Note:  To specify the line width, color, and other properties before you draw, select the
paragraphs: desired tool, and press Ctrl+E to open the properties toolbar. Set the desired options in the
sentences: desired tool, and press Ctrl+E to open the properties toolbar.
Set the desired options in the

outline.text: Properties toolbar.
paragraphs: 2.   Draw in the PDF:
To create a cloud or polygon shape, click to create the start point, move the
pointer, and click to create each segment. To finish drawing the shape, click the
start point, or right-click and choose Complete from the menu. Double-click to
end a polygon line.
To draw a line, arrow, or rectangle, either drag across the area where you want
the markup to appear, or click twice: once to create the start point and once to
create the end point.
To draw a square or circle, or to draw a line that's horizontal, vertical, or at a 45
angle, press Shift while you draw.
To draw free-form lines using the  Draw  tool, drag where you want to begin
drawing. You can release the mouse button, move the pointer to a new
location, and continue drawing. To erase parts of the drawing, select the  Erase
sentences: 2.   Draw in the PDF: To create a cloud or polygon shape, click to create the start point, move the pointer, and click to create each segment.
To finish drawing the shape, click the start point, or right-click and choose Complete from the menu.
Double-click to end a polygon line.
To draw a line, arrow, or rectangle, either drag across the area where you want the markup to appear, or click twice: once to create the start point and once to create the end point.
To draw a square or circle, or to draw a line that's horizontal, vertical, or at a 45 angle, press Shift while you draw.
To draw free-form lines using the  Draw  tool, drag where you want to begin drawing.
You can release the mouse button, move the pointer to a new location, and continue drawing.
To erase parts of the drawing, select the  Erase

outline.text: a drawing  tool
paragraphs: and drag across the areas of the drawing that you want to
remove.
sentences: and drag across the areas of the drawing that you want to remove.

outline.text: 3.   To edit or resize the markup, select it and drag one of the handles to make your
paragraphs: adjustments.
sentences: adjustments.

outline.text: 4.   To add a note to the markup, select the markup and then select  Add note  in the quick
paragraphs: action pop-up menu.
Add note to markup
sentences: action pop-up menu.
Add note to markup

outline.text: 5.   (Optional) Click the close button in the pop-up note. A note icon appears to the right
paragraphs: of the markup to indicate the presence of text in the pop-up note.
sentences: of the markup
to indicate the presence of text in the pop-up note.

outline.text: Note:   To delete a drawing markup, select it and press Delete.
paragraphs: Also, you can edit PDFs with comments online. Our online PDF editor lets you easily add text,
sticky notes, highlights, drawings, and more to PDFs.
sentences: Also, you can edit PDFs with comments online.
Our online PDF editor lets you easily add text, sticky notes, highlights, drawings, and more to PDFs.

outline.text: Add a line
paragraphs: 1.   From the Quick action toolbar, select the  Draw freehand  tool.
2.   Select the  Line  tool
3.   Drag across the area where you want the line to appear.
sentences: 1.   From the Quick action toolbar, select the  Draw freehand  tool.
2.   Select the  Line  tool 3.   Drag across the area where you want the line to appear.

outline.text: Group and ungroup markups
paragraphs: You can group two or more markups so that your comments function as a single comment.
You might group markups temporarily to move them to a new location or to modify their
properties rather than editing each one individually. Grouping also helps to distinguish your
sentences: You can group two or more markups so that your comments function as a single comment.
You might group markups temporarily to move them to a new location or to modify their properties rather than editing each one individually.
Grouping also helps to distinguish your

outline.text: markups from other reviewers' markups in a document review.
paragraphs: Note:  You cannot group text edit markups.
sentences: Note:  You cannot group text edit markups.

outline.text: Group markups
paragraphs: 1.   Using the Select tool or the Hand tool, select a markup.
2.   Ctrl-click/Command-click to select the markups you want to group.
3.   Right-click within the selection, and choose  Group .
sentences: 1.   Using the Select tool or the Hand tool, select a markup.
2.   Ctrl-click/Command-click to select the markups you want to group.
3.   Right-click within the selection, and choose  Group .

outline.text: Ungroup markups
paragraphs: 1.   Right-click the grouped selection, and choose  Ungroup .
sentences: 1.   Right-click the grouped selection, and choose  Ungroup .

outline.text: Add comments in a text box or callout
You can use the  Add text comment  tool to create a box that contains text. You can position it
paragraphs: anywhere on the page and adjust it to any size. A text box remains visible on the document
page; it doesn't close like a pop-up note.
sentences: anywhere on the page and adjust it to any size.
A text box remains visible on the document page; it doesn't close like a pop-up note.

outline.text: Text font and size are based on the system's default settings.
paragraphs: Note:
You can add comments to Japanese, Chinese, and Korean text with the  Text Box  tool,
but you must have the Asian-language resource files installed. Text boxes allow for
horizontal text only.
sentences: Note: You can add comments to Japanese, Chinese, and Korean text with the  Text Box  tool, but you must have the Asian-language resource files installed.
Text boxes allow for horizontal text only.

outline.text: You can use the  Text callout  tool to create a callout text box. Callout text boxes are handy
paragraphs: when you want to single out-but not obscure-a particular area of a document. Callout text
boxes have three parts: a text box, a knee line, and an end-point line. You can resize each part
by dragging a handle. The knee line can be resized in one direction only; horizontal knee lines
can be resized horizontally only; vertical knee lines can be resized vertically only. The text box
expands vertically as you type so that all text remains visible.
You can move the text box itself or together with the end-point line. The text box moves
around a stationary anchor point-the arrow on the end-point line-created when you first
click in the PDF. You can modify the color and appearance of the text box and add arrows or
leaders to the end-point line.
sentences: when you want to single out-but not obscure-a particular area of a document.
Callout text boxes have three parts: a text box, a knee line, and an end-point line.
You can resize each part by dragging a handle.
The knee line can be resized in one direction only; horizontal knee lines can be resized horizontally only; vertical knee lines can be resized vertically only.
The text box expands vertically as you type so that all text remains visible.
You can move the text box itself or together with the end-point line.
The text box moves around a stationary anchor point-the arrow on the end-point line-created when you first click in the PDF.
You can modify the color and appearance of the text box and add arrows or leaders to the end-point line.

outline.text: Add a comment in text box
paragraphs: 1.   From the  Quick action toolbar , select  Add a comment  >  Add text comment .
2.   Select a location in the PDF where you want to add the text.
Enter the text. The text wraps automatically when it reaches the right edge of the box.
sentences: 1.   From the  Quick action toolbar , select  Add a comment  >
Add text comment .
2.   Select a location in the PDF where you want to add the text.
Enter the text.
The text wraps automatically when it reaches the right edge of the box.

outline.text: Set or change properties for the text box
Select the  Set or change properties for the selected text  icon in the quick tools menu to
paragraphs: change the text color, alignment, and font attributes for the text.
To make further changes to the text box:
sentences: change the text color, alignment, and font attributes for the text.
To make further changes to the text box:

paragraphs: Using the  Select  tool, select an edge of the text box and then drag a corner to resize it.
Right-click the text box to open the Text Box Properties and change the border and fill
options.
sentences: Using the  Select  tool, select an edge of the text box and then drag a corner to resize it.
Right-click the text box to open the Text Box Properties and change the border and fill options.

paragraphs: Double-click the text box to edit the text or change the text attributes. Drag across the
text to select it, then select options from the quick tools menu.
sentences: Double-click the text box to edit the text or change the text attributes.
Drag across the text to select it, then select options from the quick tools menu.

outline.text: To delete the text box, select it and then press  Delete .
paragraphs: Note:  You can also paste a block of text by selecting and copying the text in any
application, selecting the Hand tool in Acrobat, and choosing Edit > Paste.
sentences: Note:  You can also paste a block of text by selecting and copying the text in any application, selecting the Hand tool in Acrobat, and choosing Edit > Paste.

outline.text: Add a comment in callout
paragraphs: 1.   From the quick tools menu, select  Draw freehand  >  Text callout .
2.   Select once to set the location of the end point, and select again to set the location of
the text box.
3.   (Optional) Select  Set or change properties   for the selected text  icon in the quick
tools menu, and then select the text's color, alignment, and font attributes.
4.   Enter the text. Text wraps automatically when it reaches the right edge of the box.
5.   (Optional) To make further changes to the text box:
To resize the callout, select it and drag any of the handles that appear.
To move the text box, click inside the box and drag it.
To move the entire callout, click either the end-point line or an edge of the text
box, and drag it.
To change the color, opacity, or line characteristics, right-click and
choose  Properties , and then select the options you want.
sentences: 1.   From the quick tools menu, select  Draw freehand  >  Text callout .
2.   Select once to set the location of the end point, and select again to set the location of the text box.
3.   (Optional) Select  Set or change properties   for the selected text  icon in the quick tools menu, and then select the text's color, alignment, and font attributes.
4.   Enter the text.
Text wraps automatically when it reaches the right edge of the box.
5.   (Optional) To make further changes to the text box: To resize the callout, select it and drag any of the handles that appear.
To move the text box, click inside the box and drag it.
To move the entire callout, click either the end-point line or an edge of the text box, and drag it.
To change the color, opacity, or line characteristics, right-click and choose  Properties , and then select the options you want.

outline.text: Add comments in a file attachment
paragraphs: Note:   In Acrobat Reader , commenting tools are available only in PDFs that have
commenting enabled. PDFs in a review workflow typically include commenting rights.
sentences: Note:   In Acrobat Reader , commenting tools are available only in PDFs that have commenting enabled.
PDFs in a review workflow typically include commenting rights.

outline.text: Use the  Attach file  tool to embed a file at a selected location in a PDF, so that the reader can
paragraphs: open it for viewing. By adding attachments as a comment, you can reference longer
documents that can't easily be pasted into a pop-up note or text box. If you move the PDF to
a new location, the embedded file automatically goes with it. To view an attachment, the
sentences: open it for viewing.
By adding attachments as a comment, you can reference longer documents that can't easily be pasted into a pop-up note or text box.
If you move the PDF to a new location, the embedded file automatically goes with it.
To view an attachment, the

outline.text: reader must have an application installed that can open the attachment.
paragraphs: Note:  Be sure to use the  Attach file  option from the Add Comments tool when
attaching files for a document review. Document-level file attachments that you attach
using the  Attach file  tool from the   Edit  >  More  menu aren't tracked with other
comments in a review workflow and may cause your attached comments to be lost.
1.   From the quick tools menu, select  Add a comment  >  Attach file .
2.   Click in the PDF where you want to place the attachment.
3.   Select the file that you want to attach, and then click  Open . If you're attaching a PDF,
you can highlight areas of interest in the file using comments.
4.   In the  File Attachment Properties  dialog box, select the settings for the file icon that
appears in the PDF and select  OK .
The comment attachment also appears in the Attachments tab (in the right navigation
pane) with a page number indicating its location.
Note:  To delete the attachment, right-click the attached comment icon, and choose
Delete.
sentences: Note:  Be sure to use the  Attach file  option from the Add Comments tool when attaching files for a document review.

Document-level file attachments that you attach using the  Attach file  tool from the   Edit  >  More  menu aren't tracked with other comments in a review workflow and may cause your attached comments to be lost.
1.   From the quick tools menu, select  Add a comment  >  Attach file .
2.   Click in the PDF where you want to place the attachment.
3.   Select the file that you want to attach, and then click  Open .
If you're attaching a PDF, you can highlight areas of interest in the file using comments.
4.   In the  File Attachment Properties  dialog box, select the settings for the file icon that appears in the PDF and select  OK .
The comment attachment also appears in the Attachments tab (in the right navigation pane) with a page number indicating its location.
Note:  To delete the attachment, right-click the attached comment icon, and choose Delete.

outline.text: Commenting preferences
paragraphs: Commenting preferences affect both the appearance of and the way you view annotations
sentences: Commenting preferences affect both the appearance of and the way you view annotations

outline.text: and markups in PDFs.
paragraphs: Note:   A reviewer can place comments anywhere within the document frame. As a
result, sometimes you need to scroll or zoom out to see comments that are located off
the page.
In the Preferences dialog box under Categories, select Commenting.
sentences: Note:   A reviewer can place comments anywhere within the document frame.
As a result, sometimes you need to scroll or zoom out to see comments that are located off the page.
In the Preferences dialog box under Categories, select Commenting.

outline.text: Viewing comments
Font, Font Size
In Windows , you can determine the font and the size of text in pop-up notes. In  Mac OS , you
paragraphs: can select only Large, Medium, or Small settings for the font. This setting applies to all new
and existing comments.
sentences: can select only Large, Medium, or Small settings for the font.
This setting applies to all new and existing comments.

outline.text: Pop-up Opacity
paragraphs: Determines the opacity of comment pop-up notes in values from 1 to 100. When a pop-up
note is open but not selected, an opacity value of 100 makes the note opaque, while lower
values make it more transparent.
sentences: Determines the opacity of comment pop-up notes in values from 1 to 100.
When a pop-up note is open but not selected, an opacity value of 100 makes the note opaque, while lower values make it more transparent.

outline.text: Enable Text Indicators And Tooltips
paragraphs: Shows a tool tip when you place the pointer over a comment that includes a pop-up note.
The tool tip contains the author name, comment status, and two lines of the text. Selected by
default.
sentences: Shows a tool tip when you place the pointer over a comment that includes a pop-up note.
The tool tip contains the author name, comment status, and two lines of the text.
Selected by default.

outline.text: Print Notes And Pop-ups
paragraphs: Specifies that pop-up notes associated with comments, and icons for note, audio, and file
attachments print exactly as they appear on the page.
Instead of selecting this option, you can print comment text in various layouts by choosing
sentences: Specifies that pop-up notes associated with comments, and icons for note, audio, and file attachments print exactly as they appear on the page.
Instead of selecting this option, you can print comment text in various layouts by choosing

outline.text: File > Print, and click  Summarize Comments .
Show Lines Connecting Comment Markups To Their Pop-ups On Mouse Rollover
paragraphs: When you place the pointer over a comment markup (such as a highlight or a note icon), the
shaded connector line appears. Selected by default.
sentences: When you place the pointer over a comment markup (such as a highlight or a note icon), the shaded connector line appears.
Selected by default.

outline.text: Ensure That Pop-ups Are Visible As The Document Is Scrolled
paragraphs: As you scroll a PDF, the pop-up notes on a given page shift to stay in view within the
document pane. Selected by default.
sentences: As you scroll a PDF, the pop-up notes on a given page shift to stay in view within the document pane.
Selected by default.
